segments.text: I see the woman drying that plate, and I feel so sad for her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's completely unaware of the water spilling out of the sink, the puddle forming around her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be so tired, so lost in thought, to not notice any of this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice her apron is neat and clean, despite the mess around her, and it makes me feel even sadder.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the kids behind her, being so mischievous, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be a hard worker, to be so focused on drying that plate, even with everything else going on.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the light coming in from the window, illuminating the scene, and it feels so peaceful compared to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I want to give her a hug, to tell her everything is going to be okay.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy on the tipping stool, reaching for the cookies, and I hope she doesn't turn around and get startled.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she deserves a break, someone to take care of her for once.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the girl waiting for her cookie, so innocent and eager, and it makes me smile a little.
segments.speaker: PAR
